H0.text: Habitat destruction was most likely the cause of the extinction of 60–100 species of native birds in Hawaii since the arrival of colonists.

H1.text: Volcanic eruptions were most likely the cause of the extinction of 60‑100 species of native birds in Hawaii since the arrival of colonists.

H2.text: Increased salinity was most likely the cause of the extinction of 60‑100 species of native birds in Hawaii since the arrival of colonists.

H3.text: Tidal waves were most likely the cause of the extinction of 60–100 species of native Hawaiian birds since the arrival of colonists.

A5.text: Invasive species can change the environment, limiting resources for native species.
